job.title: Business Development Rep - Insurance - Caribbean Territory
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Role: The Business Development Representative (BDR) responsible for driving sales of Moody’s Analytics products to new customers for their initial use.. Key activities include initiating sales activity with new-to-company prospects through lead research and qualification. Using a consultative sales approach, you will identify and develop a good understanding of the clients’ business needs and deliver an value proposition of Moody’s Analytics that satisfy those needs.  You will be responsible for managing the complete sales cycle from start to finish and based on the complexity of the opportunity, you may engage sales specialists to facilitate the sales process.  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Manage a wide sales territory of new-to-Moody’s prospects.  Build and execute on territory-based campaigns to meet or exceed annual sales goals.
  • Establish Moody’s Analytics presence with new-to-company prospects with the goal to land our initial solution at these accounts.
  • Execute against territory-based campaign plans to generate sales from new customers.
  • Work with sales colleagues to drive the sales process from beginning to end by identifying and qualifying prospects, initiating new sales activity, and managing sales cycles to closure. Typical contacts include single-use buying influencers.
  • Assess the needs of the client by gaining an understanding of the challenges they face based on their business objectives and position relevant Moody’s Analytics use cases
  • Coordinate Moody's Analytics responses to requests for product and services information from prospects and clients.
  • Represent company at industry and company sponsored events, as required.
  • Provide current forecasts and pipeline information to management.
  • Position requires travel (approximately 20% to 40% of your time). 

Qualifications:

 

  • Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelor’s degree) required, with coursework in business, economics, finance, marketing or related fields.
  • 8+ years’ experience working in direct business-to-business sales roles with a focus on solutions selling
  • Ability to lead standard sales cycles to successful conclusion.
  • Experience with sales enablement tools (Salesforce, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn, SalesLoft, etc.) to create professional, tailored prospecting strategies
  • Ability to present high-level information as well as detailed demonstrations of products & services.
  • Fundamental understanding of industry dynamics and how clients interact with the products/services
  • Willingness to create high-volume and quality client interactions/connects by making daily sales calls, networking, building relationships and identifying sales opportunities
  • Ability to design and articulate a proposition for the customer and win/close business
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment, with focus and high attention to detail.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$117,000]] to [[$152,000]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for a completion bonus. Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For San Francisco positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

This position may be considered a promotional opportunity, pursuant to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

job.title: Business Delivery Manager
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. Role / Responsibilities:

Methodology Delivery Team

We are looking for a highly-motivated individual to join as Assistant Vice President-Delivery Manager in the Methodology Delivery Team. The Team is responsible for methodology project delivery using agile principles according to plan and scope.

The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Creating and leading positive, collaborative, and supported working group environments
  • Driving scrum meetings and delivering successful results on a timely and consistent basis
  • Facilitating working group discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution
  • Proactively assessing and managing project risks and mitigation plans
  • Driving communication, improving transparency, and radiating information amongst stakeholders
  • Continuous coaching and training working groups in agile and lean principles
  • Tracking and reporting progress and dependencies, proactively identifying roadblocks and removing impediments
  • Supporting management with periodic and ad-hoc reporting
  • Managing working group commitments and deliverables

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree required preferably in business or technology.
  • Eight to ten years of experience in managing complex, global and fast-paced cross functional projects following agile principles.
  • Strong communications skills (oral and written) including experience in moderating working group sessions for consensus building.
  • Excellent judgement and problem-solving skills, ability to negotiate interpersonal, inter-team conflict sessions.
  • Exceptional organizational skills and ability to be agile and handle multiple projects and timelines while being detail oriented.
  • Strong team player with the ability to work independently - proactive, flexible, diligent, with the highest ethical standards.
  • High level of personal initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Proficiency in Agile Project Management tools (Jira, Confluence).
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Teams.
  • Scrum master certification is a plus, but not essential.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  [[$139,800]]  to  [[$202,650]] , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role is eligible for incentive compensation. Moody’s also offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, parental leave, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, a discounted employee stock purchase plan, and tuition reimbursement.

job.title: IT Asset Mgmt Associate
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. This job involves managing IT assets across North America. The role requires frequent communication with HR, legal teams, and third-party vendors, and involves responsibilities such as inventory and ticket management, problem-solving, policy implementation, hardware management, and support for accounts payable.

Responsibilities:

  • Communication: Manage email and MS Teams messages promptly.
  • Inventory Management: Maintain hardware inventory and investigate any variances.
  • Ticket Management: Update tickets in ServiceNow with relevant details. Document and report any process failures to the VP.
  • Problem-Solving: Identify issues, develop proactive solutions, and ensure compliance with IT operational performance metrics and SLAs.
  • Policy Implementation: Implement and maintain policies, procedures, and performance standards. Document these procedures and any updates.
  • Receiving Hardware: Manage the receipt of new and used hardware, including updating ITAM and coordinating with facilities team. Requires after hours support for larger deliveries.
  • Hardware Disposal and Repurposing: Coordinate the disposal or repurposing of hardware, including wiping hard drives and coordinating with third-party vendors.
  • Stockroom Management: Maintain stockroom organization and inventory levels, and manage offsite storage.
  • Equipment Requests: Fulfill equipment shipping requests to regional offices.
  • Hardware Servicing: Coordinate warranty repairs with OEMs.
  • Legal Holds: Manage the legal hold ticket queue and the storage of devices on legal hold.
  • Accounts Payable Support: Update the GRN Excel file with the status of items received against PO.
  • Ad-hoc Projects: Participate in donations and GRE-related projects.

Key Competencies:

  • Ability to work independently
  • Team player with a positive attitude
  • Strong communication skills and professionalism
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage priorities
  • Willingness to go beyond normal job requirements

Required Qualifications:

  • Intermediate Excel proficiency
  • English language proficiency
  • Understanding of IT Asset Management lifecycle and best practices
  • Experience with ServiceNow
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows and M365.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  $56,200.00 to $90,000.00, depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. Role:

Provide superior customer and external relations by resolving client issues and requests while serving as the initial point of contact for a wide range of research and data products. Additionally, proactively identify new products and sales leads through client interaction. The knowledge and experience gained in this role will help with future development within Moody’s Analytics.

summary.job_summary: The financial modeling team, part of Model Development group building world’s best catastrophe models, focus on providing end-to-end solutions to analyzing the financial impact of RMS’s catastrophe models. Our responsibility includes building analytical and simulation models for financial contracts and metrics for portfolio analysis, developing algorithms, writing specs, building prototypes on distributed environment and implementing production software on AWS based SaaS platform. Our scope also includes supply chain modelling and simulation, machine learning applications in exposure data analysis, such as image analysis and large dataset mining using deep learning and classical machine learning tools. We also perform applied research in these areas.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

About the Team

The financial modeling team, part of Model Development group building world’s best catastrophe models, focus on providing end-to-end solutions to analyzing the financial impact of RMS’s catastrophe models. Our responsibility includes building analytical and simulation models for financial contracts and metrics for portfolio analysis, developing algorithms, writing specs, building prototypes on distributed environment and implementing production software on AWS based SaaS platform. Our scope also includes supply chain modelling and simulation, machine learning applications in exposure data analysis, such as image analysis and large dataset mining using deep learning and classical machine learning tools. We also perform applied research in these areas.     

 

Senior Software Engineer

We are looking for a Senior Scientific Programmer to join a growing team of developers and modelers. We are seeking someone who is excited about tackling complex software challenges and solving difficult business problems.

As a senior programmer, you are expected to be proficient writing production quality code in an object-oriented language. You must be able to dive into any existing code.  You must be a strong team player, contributing ideas and taking constructive critical feedback. You should be able to work independently, juggling multiple items concurrently while contributing to multiple areas within a large project.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 3+ years of programming experience; proven track record of on-time delivery
  • Experience writing production-level code in C#, Java, or C++.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
  • Familiarity with probability and statistics.
  • Master’s degree in STEM field.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Experience in linear programming applications.
  • 5+ years of programming experience
  • Experience in performance tuning and bottleneck analysis
  • Python experience
  • Machine learning experience.

For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is  $131,500.00 to $210,500.00, depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for a completion bonus. Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.

summary.job_summary: The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting, capital markets, and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset, an interest in growing their competency and career, and a desire to collaborate with a global team, particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

job.name: projects/talent-cloud-jobs-prod/tenants/4f3343ee-2900-0000-0000-009477c2ccf2/jobs/73376590102176454
job.title: Data Operations Specialist
job.primary_address: MIS Support Center, 4th floor, East Tower, Eurocenter Business Center
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

Role/Responsibilities:

The Digital Insights OU is hiring for an initiative to increase recognition of Moody’s value proposition among a wide range of financial market participants by providing highest level of financials data governance and ensure data quality and usability of our products.

The Data Operations Specialist will work within an initiative focused in analyzing published financial documents of corporate entities around the globe. The role will leverage competency in accounting, capital markets, and financial statement analysis to extract relevant data and insights from published documents. The ideal candidate will possess a goal-oriented mindset, an interest in growing their competency and career, and a desire to collaborate with a global team, particularly partnering with the Data Operations Lead/SME and the Data Operations Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzing and extracting data, insights, and other information from financial documents
  • Reviewing financial documents which include Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement from the annual/interim and regulatory statements of entities across the world
  • Knowledge of US GAAP, local GAAP, and/or IFRS, is required (knowledge of several and others is a bonus)
  • Conducting detailed quality checks of own work, as well as others is required
  • Adhering to timeliness deadlines with quality output is a primary characteristic of the work
  • Ability to work independently and in a global team
Qualifications :

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field required

Languages:

  • English: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Spanish: Advanced written and verbal command
  • Business proficiency in other languages a plus

Skills and Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience of analyzing financial statements
  • Advanced understanding of various company filings (10K, annual reports, Solvency reports) and should be comfortable with secondary research
  • Hands on experience extracting pertinent insights from financial statements
  • Knowledge of accounting/financial documents
  • Superior attention to detail, analytical ability and problem-solving skills
  • Organized, dependable, able to multi-task and manage priorities, display initiative, and the ability to work independently
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products and particularly Excel, such as pivot tables, lookups, etc.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

summary.job_summary: The Moody’s Community Impact Team is dedicated to making a positive difference in our communities and the lives of our employees around the globe through alignment of philanthropy and employee engagement with Moody’s vision and business opportunities. Our commitment is built on our employees’ deeply ingrained sense of social responsibility and the recognition that our company grows stronger by helping to advance the lives of others through responsible business practices and corporate citizenship. Through our active participation in our communities, we better understand needs and opportunities for improvement, and strive to address those needs and opportunities that are most consistent with the values of our corporation and employees. The Community Impact team coordinates Community Impact activities, and through the Moody’s Foundation, manages relationships with non-profit organization. Every Moody’s employee has the opportunity to serve the community through volunteerism, employee-directed giving, and/or board service. The Moody’s Foundation is funded by an annual distribution from Moody’s Corporation.

job.title: Community Impact Intern
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

The Department / Team:

The Moody’s Community Impact Team is dedicated to making a positive difference in our communities and the lives of our employees around the globe through alignment of philanthropy and employee engagement with Moody’s vision and business opportunities. Our commitment is built on our employees’ deeply ingrained sense of social responsibility and the recognition that our company grows stronger by helping to advance the lives of others through responsible business practices and corporate citizenship. Through our active participation in our communities, we better understand needs and opportunities for improvement, and strive to address those needs and opportunities that are most consistent with the values of our corporation and employees. The Community Impact team coordinates Community Impact activities, and through the Moody’s Foundation, manages relationships with non-profit organization. Every Moody’s employee has the opportunity to serve the community through volunteerism, employee-directed giving, and/or board service. The Moody’s Foundation is funded by an annual distribution from Moody’s Corporation. 

Role Overview:

  • The candidate will be engaged in a fast-paced, collaborative environment – working side by side with experience Community Impact professionals to support the implementation of global charitable giving and employee volunteer program
  • This person will develop knowledge and skills that will enhance their educational experience and set them up for success upon completion of their degree program
  • Benchmarking corporate philanthropy landscape, best practices, and trends
  • Supporting Community Impact communications for internal and external audiences
  • Additional responsibilities include:
    • Assist Foundation team with current projects
    • Research current social media trends and suggest videos, posts, or concepts
    • Develop social media strategy for employee network – Community Activities Board
    • Design internal employee benefits SharePoint
    • Design marketing brochure for both internal and external use outlining our matching gifts, matching volunteer, and community grants programs
    • Support programs and activities supporting community outreach efforts

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate rising junior (2026 graduate)
  • We are looking for a candidate that has good communication skills, good analytical skills, and a strong ability to collaborate with different groups 
  • Experience with Microsoft Applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

summary.job_summary: The Senior ESG Associate (“The Associate”) will work with analysts in the ESG team in supporting the systematic and transparent integration of ESG considerations into credit analysis. The Associate will support the ongoing monitoring of ESG Issuer Profile and Credit Impact scores for systematically integrating ESG considerations into credit analysis, and to transparently communicate our opinions through narratives and credit opinions. This may include participation in relevant rating committees and discussion forums.

job.name: projects/talent-cloud-jobs-prod/tenants/4f3343ee-2900-0000-0000-009477c2ccf2/jobs/111198681996108486
job.title: Senior ESG Associate
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

 The Role

The Senior ESG Associate (“The Associate”) will work with analysts in the ESG team in supporting the systematic and transparent integration of ESG considerations into credit analysis. The Associate will support the ongoing monitoring of ESG Issuer Profile and Credit Impact scores for systematically integrating ESG considerations into credit analysis, and to transparently communicate our opinions through narratives and credit opinions. This may include participation in relevant rating committees and discussion forums.

The Associate will also support the systematic collection of issuer-level ESG metrics and data to support MIS’ credit analysis, including from Moody’s Analytics. The Associate may also support the production of ESG-related Non-credit rating assessments (NCRAs) such as carbon transition indicators and net zero assessments. Other responsibilities my include, as needed, supporting various projects of the ESG team, including the publication of thematic research, development of ESG training modules, and representing MIS in the external market on ESG matters.

The Associate role is integral to Moody’s focus on the integration of ESG considerations into credit analysis. This role, like that of the ESG team broadly, will typically span across multiple rating groups.

 

Key Responsibilities

Portfolio Management & Credit Quality

  • Working with ESG analysts to support ESG integration into credit analysis.  Examples of analytical work may include:

  • Support ESG analysts’ research contributing to the monitoring and maintenance of ESG scores

  • Prepare periodic analysis of ESG score changes and trends

  • Contribute to the development of databases and data analysis systems and outputs using third-party data and research, public company filings and other public information as key inputs, including managing the data collection, data entry process

  • Developing familiarity with the ESG classification, heat maps, cross-sector methodology and scoring distribution across sectors and geographies

  • Developing a working knowledge of Moody’s methodologies and credit rating best practices.

  • Monitoring ESG trends by following market developments and relevant news events, analyzing issuer reporting, and supporting ESG team engagement with issuers as necessary.

  • Attending, where appropriate, rating committee meetings, including to offer analysis and opinion

Credit Administration

  • Support the ongoing development of an ESG data platform, including third-party sources and from Moody’s Analytics.

  • Collaborate with ESG support teams at affiliates ICRA and MSC to ensure seamless support to the ESG team’s efforts in data gathering and research support

  • Supporting the operation and maintenance of the ESG scoring platform.

  • Demonstrating sound understanding and judgment in applying Moody’s processes, documentation standards, and best practices, and adhering to all laws and policies.

  • Supporting the ESG team’s work with Moody’s University in maintaining and updating, as needed, a comprehensive ESG training and certification program

  • Providing feedback to the manager on the quality and accuracy of work produced by the ICRA and MSC teams, while providing constructive and proactive feedback.

Research, Investor Outreach & Market Interaction

  • Support ESG analysts in publishing thematic and issuer-specific research on ESG risks relevant to credit analysis. 

  • Collaborate with other internal teams including the broader Moody’s family outside the ratings agency and Information Technology team members as required.

  • Attending investor briefings and conferences as required; helping prepare presentation materials in some cases; arriving prepared to engage in discussions.

  • Building positive relationships with investors displaying initiative to understand the investors’ approach to ESG and proactively responding to inquiries.

Risk Identification and Escalation

  • Support compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures to certify relevant key codes as required.  Complete mandatory required training in a timely manner. 

  • Awareness of Moody’s risk management approach.

 

Experience / Qualifications

  • Minimum undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g. Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent qualifications) with strong academic performance (in the US, minimum GPA of 3.0). Masters/MBA preferred.

  • An understanding of current trends in ESG and sustainable investing is an advantage.

  • Some relevant experience (including internships) in ESG integration into fixed income or equity analysis is preferred

  • Background in process oriented/data heavy tasks preferred

  • Excellent verbal, written communication, and interpersonal skills.

  • Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills would be an advantage

  • Proactive and able to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.

  • Strong organization skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.

  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly. 

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

For more information on the Securities Trading Program, please refer to the STP Quick Reference guide on ComplianceNet

Please note: STP categories are assigned by the hiring teams and are subject to change over the course of an employee’s tenure with Moody’s.

summary.job_summary: Join our vibrant team as a Junior Java Software Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of ingesting diverse data domains into cutting-edge NoSQL datastores and Elasticsearch using Apache Kafka and Apache Flink. This role offers an incredible opportunity to learn and grow rapidly in a dynamic, tech-driven environment.

job.name: projects/talent-cloud-jobs-prod/tenants/4f3343ee-2900-0000-0000-009477c2ccf2/jobs/80693831395091142
job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity


The Data Solutions division is the commercial data business of Moody’s Analytics, bringing together a vast catalogue of data to help business decision-makers assess risks and opportunities. We are best known for Orbis, the world’s most comprehensive database of public and private companies. We are also the definitive source of ratings-related data for companies and securities that have been rated by Moody’s Investors Service. We strive to deliver convenience and insight to our customers by eliminating the hassle of sourcing, preparing and accessing data, adding value when decisions need to be made. Any analytical activity depends on reliable and accessible data, and we are proud to be a mission-critical information resource for decision-makers around the world. 
Are you a forward-thinking and agile learner keen on being part of a dynamic shift from batch processing to real-time stream processing? 
Join our vibrant team as a Junior Java Software Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of ingesting diverse data domains into cutting-edge NoSQL datastores and Elasticsearch using Apache Kafka and Apache Flink. This role offers an incredible opportunity to learn and grow rapidly in a dynamic, tech-driven environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Dive into the world of stream processing by actively contributing to the design and development of real-time data ingestion pipelines using Java, Apache Kafka, and Apache Flink.
  • Collaborate closely with diverse teams to comprehend evolving data requirements and pioneer scalable solutions in the realm of stream processing.
  • Optimize and fine-tune our transition from batch to stream processing, focusing on performance, scalability, and reliability enhancements.
  • Actively engage in troubleshooting, ensuring seamless error handling for uninterrupted stream processing operations.
  • Contribute to comprehensive testing and validation of real-time data pipelines, ensuring high data integrity.

Requirements:

  • A Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Java programming or a strong willingness to rapidly develop Java skills.
  • An eagerness to explore and work with cutting-edge technologies like Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB), and Elasticsearch.
  • Strong knowledge of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, adaptability, and a hunger for learning in a fast-paced environment.
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Exceptional communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Enthusiasm for tackling large-scale data challenges and a desire to grow within the field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity or interest in cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Basic understanding or exposure to containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).


 

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

For more information on the Securities Trading Program, please refer to the STP Quick Reference guide on ComplianceNet

job.title: Commercial Renewal Specialist
job.description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.

Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.

At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity

 

This role is responsible for working with sales colleagues and other internal stakeholders to manage and grow MA’s business across a territory of existing customers.  Key activities include securing renewal rates as per yearly sales defined targets for MA’s existing business, exploring opportunities to expand it and managing sales cycles to closure.  Additionally, the role requires the assessment of client needs and providing clients with specific guidance and product overviews.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Meet or exceed annual sales goals and targets.
  • Manage a portfolio of client renewals end-to-end – including driving growth through price increases or expanded scope of services, negotiating all commercial aspects of the renewals, notifying clients of upcoming contract expiration, presenting renewal proposals, and executing appropriate agreements.
  • Identify additional products and services that client may benefit generating upselling and cross-selling opportunities. Collaborate with Domain Sales, Business Development Representatives, Industry Practice Leads and Solution Specialists for lead generation of additional use cases.
  • Identify and help mitigate roadblocks at an early stage.
  • Ensure successful, on-time execution of renewal processes and contract execution.
  • Partner with colleagues in Sales, Sales Operations, and Product Management to provide seamless support during the renewal journey.
  • Identify and manage client stakeholders and build and maintain relationships with key individuals across multiple levels (primary contact, procurement, accounts payable, legal, etc.)
  • Review and understand contract terms and conditions, ensure contracts are compliant.
  • Work closely with Customer Service, Customer Success, Product Specialists and other stakeholders to assess overall account health and review client product adoption.
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Product Strategy to promote improvement in product quality and the development of new sources of revenue.
  • Support the growth and further development and automation of renewal processes for the business. 

 

Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years professional experience in sales, sales operations and/or customer success roles.-
  • Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelor’s degree) required, preferably with coursework in business, economics, finance, marketing or related fields.
  • Understanding of different parts of the global financial services industry, including market dynamics and customers’ business drivers.
  • Ability to present high-level information as well as detailed demonstrations of products & services.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written skills in English. Any additional language is beneficial.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment, with focus and high attention to detail.

#LI-ER1

 

 

Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. The salary is one component of Moody’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include the following: Medical, Personal Accident, Life Insurance and Time Off.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
